item.title: sympo: MVS | Depth Maps Fusion
item.description:
Conduct 3D reconstruction through depth map fusion.

  1. Solution categories

    • Explicitly optimization

    • Depp learning-based methods

Journey when searching “Depthmap fusion with depth and normal consistency check” DDG

  • Depthmap fusion with depth and normal consistency check

    Massively Parallel Multiview Stereopsis by Surface Normal Diffusion (ICCV 2015)

    Paper | GScholar

    • Code for Gipuma kysucix/gipuma
    • Code for Section 4.3 Fusion: kysucix/fusibile

    (2024-03-16)

    • 4.3 Fusion

      1. Obtain depth map for each view
      2. Iterate each depth map to be treated as the reference image and perform reprojection.
      3. Check if the disparity between the reference and source depth maps is lower than a threshold, so as to determine valid 3D points.
      4. Check if the estimated surface normal direction consistent among all views.
      5. Check the if reprojected depth on other view is consistent with the reference view.

    • Accuracy and completeness is a trade-off.

  • RoutedFusion: Learning Real-time Depth Map Fusion ~ CVPR 2020

    Arxiv

    (2024-03-15)

    • 2D depth routing network + 3D depth fusion network
    • Less training data

  • A Review of Depth and Normal Fusion Algorithms

    pmc | Sensors MDPI

  • Depth (and Normal) Map Fusion Algorithm - GitHub

    Code

  • Multi-view stereo via depth map fusion: A coordinate decent optimization method (CoD-Fusion)

    Neurocomputing 2015 | Zhaoxin Li, HIT

    (2024-03-15)

    • Goal of depth map fusion is recovering the surface.

    • Use coordinate descent to decompose the energy functional (Ê≥õÂáΩ) for each voxel.

    • 3D total variance TV is the loss function. So the Objective function = TV + regularizer L. Naming refers to Fast Optimization Methods for L1 Regularization - ECML07 and MIT courseware
